title: Citi Cubs Kids Program Resumes Its Second Season of Providing Chicago Children Communities with Motivational and Educational Experience
summary: Chicago, Ill. – Citi will resume its 2011 Citi Cubs Kids season with back-to-back programs just prior to the Cubs hosting the World Champion San Francisco Giants at Wrigley Field on Wednesday, June 29, and Thursday, June 30. Both programs will be held at The Inter-American Magnet School (851 W. Waveland Ave, Chicago, Ill.), and former Cubs legend Lee Smith and team Chairman and Owner Tom Ricketts will be guest speakers.
tag-1: Citi Cubs Kids Program Resumes Its Second Season of Providing Chicago Children Communities with Motivational and Educational Experience
tag-3: Chicago, Ill. – Citi will resume its 2011 Citi Cubs Kids season with back-to-back programs just prior to the Cubs hosting the World Champion San Francisco Giants at Wrigley Field on Wednesday, June 29, and Thursday, June 30. Both programs will be held at The Inter-American Magnet School (851 W. Waveland Ave, Chicago, Ill.), and former Cubs legend Lee Smith and team Chairman and Owner Tom Ricketts will be guest speakers.
tag-4: In its second season, Citi Cubs Kids is an educational and motivational community-based initiative for Chicago students, developed by Citi in collaboration with the Jackie Robinson Foundation and the Cubs.
tag-5: The series of six in-season events will seek to positively impact students through the nine values and ideals of Jackie Robinson, the legendary pioneer and great American trailblazer who broke baseball's color barrier with the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1947.
tag-6: Each of the Citi Cubs Kids visits will begin with a presentation rooted in mentoring and education and finishes with a trip to Wrigley Field to watch the beloved Chicago Cubs.
tag-7: "Citi is excited to continue its second season of Citi Cubs Kids and provide a unique and educational experience for deserving Chicago youth," said Doug Gourley, Managing Director of Citi Private Bank. "Our first program included motivational speeches from Cubs Hall of Famer Fergie Jenkins, and we're thrilled to host two more legendary members of the Cubs organization – Lee Smith and Tom Ricketts – for this week's events."
tag-8: "The Cubs are dedicated to playing an active role in the community and this partnership with Citi is an excellent way to help impact the lives of kids in Chicago," said Wally Hayward, Executive Vice President, Chief Marketing Officer of the Chicago Cubs. "Citi Cubs Kids reinforces positive values in Chicago's youth by offering personal interaction with role models who overcame challenges on their paths to success."
tag-9: "The Jackie Robinson Foundation Scholars are ambassadors of Jackie Robinson's philosophy that, 'A life is not important except in its impact on other lives,'" said Della Britton, President and CEO of The Jackie Robinson Foundation. "They are dynamic leaders with a commitment to public service and Jackie Robinson's humanitarian ideals, and, as such, we are proud to partner with Citi Cubs Kids in an effort to empower and educate Chicago youth through peer mentorship."
tag-10: In addition to Lee Smith, guest speakers on Wednesday will include Mr. Gourley, Managing Director of Citi Private Bank, and Jackie Robinson Foundation Scholar Inez Jones.
tag-11: Participating in Citi Cubs Kids on Wednesday are students from Jensen Academy and Chicago's Housing Authority.
tag-12: Jensen Academy is an organization whose mission is to empower all students by setting higher standards for the ever changing world and to create a safe, respectful, and positive learning environment that is conductive to all learning styles. Through literacy in reading, math, social science and technology, students have the opportunity to become higher-achieving team players and proactive members of the community.
tag-13: Chicago Housing Authority (CHA) is the largest owner of rental housing in the city of Chicago, providing homes to more than 50,000 families and individuals, while supporting healthy communities in neighborhoods all across the city. CHA has more than 9,200 apartments in buildings designated for seniors and nearly 11,000 units in family and other housing types.
tag-14: On Thursday, guest speakers will include Mr. Ricketts, Mr. Gourley and Ms. Jones, and program participants will include students from Chicago Housing Authority and Mercy Housing.
tag-15: Mercy Housing Lakefront, the Great Lakes regional business Center of the national non-profit Mercy Housing, owns and operates more than 2,000 homes in Chicago and Milwaukee. Nationally, Mercy Housing serves over 136,100 people per day in more than 39,700 homes. The children participating in Citi Cubs Kids are from families living in permanent supportive housing; housing with services that support families who have been homeless or at high risk for homelessness.
tag-16: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions.
